task_2_results.item: Verify that the electronic components are not on the Commerce Control List (CCL) or require an export license under EAR
Screen the international supplier against restricted party lists including the Denied Persons List, Entity List, and Unverified List
Obtain end-use and end-user certifications to ensure components won't be used for prohibited purposes
Request and maintain RoHS compliance documentation from the supplier, including material declarations and test reports
Verify that electronic components meet substance restriction thresholds for lead, mercury, cadmium, and other restricted materials
Obtain FCC test reports and certification documentation for electronic components that may affect electromagnetic compatibility
Verify that components meet applicable FCC emissions standards for the intended product classification
Assess the international supplier's security protocols and verify they meet C-TPAT minimum security criteria
Document the supplier's supply chain security measures and maintain records for C-TPAT compliance
